title: AITA for telling my mom to back off?

A few years ago I was friends with this lady, our mothers then became best friends which is great. I stopped talking to her after I brought a boyfriend at the time to one of her parties and they ended up hooking up. My mom and her mom stayed best friends and I never really spoke about why I stopped speaking to her so no one fully understands, which I feel is none of their business really. My mom keeps inviting this lady over whenever I'm visiting even if her mom isn't here and then tells me like a child to go greet her and keep her company. I have basic respect and will go greet her but then I end up either walking away or leaving. My mom said I was rude and need to get over whatever happened between us and I told her to back off. She is pretty upset at my response and said she just wants us all to be able to spend time together but I have absolutely no interest. I'm over the whole situation that happened back then but I just don't see myself being friends with someone who would do that. AITA or being immature?

COMPLETE STORY:
Title: AITA for being annoyed with my boyfriend for only ever talking about hunting?

I have been dating my boyfriend for three years and we moved in together recently. He got back into hunting (deer, elk, turkey) and I swear to god.. every conversation we have he relates it back to wild life or a hunting story. He goes into lengthy detail about where he went, what he saw, how many scrapes there were, how many prongs on each antler of every buck, what kind of calls he used, the weight of his arrows, he will go on for what seems like hours without any input from me. I usually just nod and mm and wow while doing other stuff around the house, half listening.

He is passionate about it, and I want to be supportive, it just doesn’t interest me other than the fact that he likes it and i want him to do what he enjoys just as i want to pursue my passions.

So, does it make me an asshole to be annoyed by his passion? Is there a way to gently tell him that I don’t need to know every single detail of every single outing he goes on without being condescending? Or is this just part of my relationship and I need to stop being self centered?

consistency_verification.prompt:
You are evaluating whether the opening of a story accurately represents the complete story.

INITIAL IMPRESSIONS FROM FIRST 50 WORDS:
- Who: The first-person narrator ("I") and a few friends—schoolmates, including one friend who told the narrator to be quiet.
- Where: On a Discord call (an online group call, while they were doing schoolwork together).
- When: Recent past — it happened "last week."

COMPLETE STORY:
title: AITAH for standing my ground against one of my friends for telling me to be quiet?

Last week I was in a Discord call with a few friends of mine. We were just chilling and also doing a bit of schoolwork. Everyone was talking over each other, and I was working on a project with one person in the call while the other two were gaming. So basically, everyone was just talking and cracking jokes every no an then.

At one point, one of them (I’ll call this person Jason) wanted to ask a question to Rico another person in the call). I didn’t know that because everyone was talking, and I was in a conversation with Evan. Suddenly, Jason said to me in an aggressive tone, “Can you stop talking?” because he wanted to ask Rico a question. I was surprised, because literally everyone was talking, but he only told me to stop talking so he could ask his question. Of course I didn’t stop talking and told Jason that he was being really aggressive toward me.

Then Jason said “shut your mouth” and “stfu.” That made me even less willing to stop talking, because now he was being openly disrespectful towards me. Then he server-muted me because he’s the server owner. In response, I server-muted him back because I’m an admin. After that, he removed my admin role, unmuted himself, and about 10 minutes later, he unmuted me and gave me my admin rights back.

At that point, I wasn’t talking anymore, but Jason and Rico were to each other (and at this point Evan was no longer present but was still in the call muted.) Later, Jason asked me something, and I said that I didn’t want to talk to him. Jason and Rico made me feel like I was overreacting. I asked Rico if he wouldn’t react the same way, and he said that he doesn’t think it’s “that deep.” I replied, “Yeah, because you’re a p*ssy,” because I honestly can’t imagine letting someone treat you like that without standing up for yourself.

After that, they both stopped talking to me, and I haven’t spoken to them since.

Am I wrong for acting the way I did?

consistency_verification.prompt:
You are evaluating whether the opening of a story accurately represents the complete story.

INITIAL IMPRESSIONS FROM FIRST 50 WORDS:
- Who: A 33-year-old single mother and her daughter (they also have seven cats).
- Where: Unspecified current residence after relocating — they left another city in February due to domestic violence.
- When: Present timeline with a recent past event (they moved in February).

COMPLETE STORY:
Title: AITA for refusing a job due to my daughter's security?

This account is new because my main was banned wrongfully and I'm appealing.

I am a 33yo single mother and I live with my daughter and our seven cats. We left another city in February due to DV, and restarting hasn't been easy.

I work with digital illustrations - and I also work as a translator and ghostwriter -, and sometimes we go through really hard times because my earnings are not constant. Right now, we have food only for today, and I have nothing to feed my cats besides a last can of sardines.

I've come to Reddit before for help, but most of the responses I got told me to get a job. Even when I tried to explain that this was one of the worst options, I searched for any job I could find, and I did. It's a minimum wage job.

Then all the problems with it that I've foreseen all along came. I don't have a safe net that I can count on to look after my daughter, and I have two options:

Paying someone to look after her, and then making enough money just to cover rent;

Leaving my 9yo daughter at home by herself.

I live in a dangerous part of my city, and in the house we live in right now the door and gate have no locks, so there's a huge risk leaving a child home alone (and also illegal in my country until 14yo). Here we have a lot of users, and almost daily we hear about people breaking in to steal and things worse.

I'm supposed to start on Monday, but it would mean not only leaving my daughter alone from 7h30 until 20h, but it also would mean stop enterily with my side jobs, and food would be scarce until I get paid.

I honestly don't think this would be the best option, and I'm afraid something happens to my daughter. I've been posting about my work anywhere I can, and I'm trying to stay by my baby's side, but I'm afraid I'm not making the right choice. I'm already waiting on government assistance, but it can take months.

- Where: An online forum (an AITA post) discussing problems in their marital home/bedroom.
- When: Present — shortly after getting married in June (recent past/ongoing).

COMPLETE STORY:
AITA if I stop sleeping with my husband?

Hi all, I know the title sounds bad but please hear me out. I recently got married in June, yay, however it's not like I expected, I know that should be obvious. But the issue is our bedroom life. Before we got married, we were active every week for two years, a little tmi but thats when he took my virginity. Since we've been married since June, the first week we were doing it every day, and then all of a sudden he didnt want to anymore, no problem we can lessen it. However, every time I try to make an advancement with him, he casually flips on or rolls onto his stomach. I've brought this up to him cause it lowkey kind of hurt being rejected, especially when he doesnt even say anything. He said he'll get better, but it's always the same, I try one day and he rolls over. I don't even know what happened, we were so active when dating, I dont know why it just vanished literally all of a sudden. I've talked to him many times and he just says he wasnt in the mood, but then I ask him why he doesnt just tell me cause its more insulting and hurtful when he literally rolls over in bed away from me. Well for a few weeks now, I've gotten use to not initiating until he does the one random weekend day, however it never feels sexy or fun. It just feels bland and plain cause he starts just touching and then we do it and then its over, and sometimes he won't finish me off, most of the time he does though. Well this morning, I felt a little extra so despite what I know, I decided to try initiate, and then after a few minutes of me kissing his forehead and warming him up, he rolls over onto his stomach. At this point I got tears in my eyes, so I roll over too cause I don't even know what to say. He rolls over and starts hugging me a few minutes later until he gets up to make breakfast. This time I didn't join him, I spent the hour in our room crying to myself and watching TikTok. He comes back into the room to get his clothes for work and asks if I'm ok and I told him how I felt, and he just says yea its cause of my knee (he had surgery on his acl several years ago but that ligament never healed right so it pops out often and causes him mild pain). And then he was being more rushed and saying he's late for work, he wasn't cause I know what time he leaves, and is out the door. I cried again and then I sent him a message saying I'm done initiating with him and that in the future if he has that rare urge that he can go back to porn and his hand cause my self esteem cant take any more rejections. Since June when we got married, I want to say we've only done it around 15-20 times as its not often he initiates either. I just dont know why his drive was so high before marriage and now its rare after marriage. But am I the asshole for what I said?

INITIAL IMPRESSIONS FROM FIRST 50 WORDS:
- Who: A 30-year-old male narrator and his 21-year-old girlfriend; the narrator's friend Turner is also mentioned.
- Where: Not specified — an informal, personal/social setting (the narrator is 'hanging out' with a friend).
- When: Contemporary/near-present — an ongoing/recent situation (present-tense narration).

COMPLETE STORY:
Title: Am i the Asshole for wanting my girlfriebd to me mature emotionally

Okay, so my (30m) girlfriend (21f) has decided its okay to stonewall me and be distant to me in our relationship. The other day i was hanging out with my friend Turner.

I told her i was going to his house. I was there for 5 hours and for three of those hours i lost track of what was happening on my phone and accidentally ignored her for 3 hours. It was not my intention. My friend Turner has severe ADHD and can talk for like 40 minutes straight. A lot of people find this annoying but i love the guy as a brother and i know he cant help it even if he tried. So to show him i care, and that im paying attention i try to not look at or be on my phone when he talks.

She came at me upset because her ex would dissapear for hours while cheating on her. I told her that i was sorry. Her feelings are valid and i know where she is coming from. I told her id put more of an effort in making sure i reply to her instead of leaving her on read like how i did. However since then she has been distant and cold. I tried to bring it up with her but she just keeps saying "I lowered my defenses and now i have to put them back up. Ive told you why im being distant." But i keep telling her its not healthy, its not appropriate, and its doing nothing but pushing us away from each other. At this point its been 3 days and she wont budge.

Im thinking i should just break up with her and just enjoy being single again for a bit. We have only been together for a month and i just feel if this is how she is going to be now, its only going to get worse. Id rather just end it now than keep trying and being hurt, for it to just fall apart again in a few months or years.

Am i the ass hole? And for context im aware the 9 year age gap seems weird. I wasnt into her because of her age, i acctually thought she was 24 or 25 when we first started talking and dating. I typically wont date anyone younger than 25.

COMPLETE STORY:
Title: AITAH for leading my friend on

I'm keeping this vague because the guy who this post is about uses Reddit. But basically I (college-age F) and a guy I'm sorta friends with (college-age M) have had a little something going on basically since we met last month. We're not dating and I don't predict this will turn into a relationship but we're both attracted to each other and the other day some stuff happened. By that I mean we made out, took clothes off, etc etc but we didn't go all the way. I have a personal boundary that I won't have s*x outside of a relationship. I haven't explicitly told him this because I didn't think it was necessary to share. I didn't think things were actually going to go that far that quick. But it's a boundary I have that I'm not going to change.

So when we were making out I stopped it before it turned into s*x. I could tell that made him upset and he hasn't really been talking to me since then. I don't think me having a boundary is wrong but I do wonder if I accidentally led him on and that's what he's upset about. Because to be fair I was the one that suggested we hang out in his room, when he said that he wanted to hook up I agreed and started to go along with it, and I didn't tell him that I was never going to have sex with him. To be completely honest I was worried he was going to lose interest in me if I told him that. Cause I do like him and I don't mind fooling around a little bit, I just have specific boundaries about how far I'll go. But I feel like I might have been a little manipulative and I feel bad about that.

setting.first_50_words: Title: AITAH for not wanting to see my dad anymore because I don’t feel his sympathy for me? I (Asian) am married to my daughter’s dad (he’s white and honestly, an AH with mental health issues), but my family doesn’t know about it. My parents are currently visiting me here

initial_impression.prompt:
You are evaluating the opening of a creative text. Read ONLY the first 50 words below and answer three questions based on what these opening words suggest.

FIRST 50 WORDS:
Title: AITAH for not wanting to see my dad anymore because I don’t feel his sympathy for me? I (Asian) am married to my daughter’s dad (he’s white and honestly, an AH with mental health issues), but my family doesn’t know about it. My parents are currently visiting me here

Answer these questions based ONLY on what you just read:
1. Who is this story about? (Describe the main character(s) or subject)
2. Where is this story set? (Describe the location)
3. When did this story happen relative to now? (e.g., "past", "present", "future", "historical period", etc.)

Respond in JSON format:

  "where": "your answer",

}

consistency_verification.prompt:
You are evaluating whether the opening of a story accurately represents the complete story.

INITIAL IMPRESSIONS FROM FIRST 50 WORDS:
- Who: The narrator — an Asian person who is married to their daughter’s father (a white man described as an AH with mental health issues); the narrator’s father and parents (who are visiting) are also central to the situation.
- Where: At the narrator’s home (unspecified location), where their parents are currently visiting.
- When: Present (events are happening now).

COMPLETE STORY:
Title: AITAH for not wanting to see my dad anymore because I don’t feel his sympathy for me?

I (Asian) am married to my daughter’s dad (he’s white and honestly, an AH with mental health issues), but my family doesn’t know about it. My parents are currently visiting me here in the US.

Lately, I’ve been seeing my husband 2–3 times a week these past few weeks, and my parents aren’t happy about it. They think I’m putting our lives at risk every time we see him.

Here’s what’s been happening:

I left him 10 days after giving birth because he wasn’t helping me with anything. I’ve been living with my family since then.

My daughter and I met with him outside our place. He wasn’t happy about how our daughter looked and started talking to me like he was scolding me. I didn’t know my dad had come outside too. My husband didn’t even greet him, just went straight to his car and drove off.

Another time, my daughter and I went with him to visit his sick grandma (she hadn’t met our daughter yet). We stayed overnight at a hotel. Around 3 AM, he suddenly wanted me to call the police because he said he didn’t feel safe. He ended up checking himself into the hospital for a mental health crisis, leaving me and our baby at the hotel. My dad freaked out when he found out because the police got involved. Back home, anything involving the police is seen as a huge deal. I explained what really happened, but they didn’t believe me.

After that third incident, my parents sat me down to ask what my plans were. I told them how I felt and said I wasn’t going back to live with my husband. I even said I’d move in with my sister until I found out she’s pregnant with her third child, so I changed my mind.

A month later, I started seeing my husband more often, and my parents weren’t happy about it. My mom asked again what my plans were with my daughter, saying if I keep seeing my daughter’s dad, there must still be “feelings involved.” (Like, wtf? Why do they even care if there are feelings involved? AITAH for that?!) I told her clearly we’re not getting back together.

Then one day, I told my dad I was meeting my husband again, with our daughter. He immediately got mad. Maybe because I’m being “stubborn”? He yelled at me, saying I’d be asking for rescue again, that they’ve “rescued us twice already,” and that I’m putting my daughter’s life in danger. He started pointing his finger at me and shouting that he wouldn’t allow it. I snapped and told him he has no right to control my life especially when he’s the one going back to our home country for his mistress. My mom got upset over what I said, and my dad called me disrespectful. Still, I left with my daughter.

He said he just feels sorry for me because of what I’ve gone through with my daughter’s dad. But honestly? I don’t feel any sympathy from him because he’s been cheating and hiding things from our family for years. Because of that, I don’t even want to see him anymore. He even blocked me on social media and IDGAF about it.

Edit: I didn’t actually asked for a rescue. He calls it rescue for volunteering to pick us up even if I insisted that we can take an uber. My dad didn’t tell me that he’s sorry for my situation, it’s just a conversation of him and my mom.

You are evaluating whether the opening of a story accurately represents the complete story.

INITIAL IMPRESSIONS FROM FIRST 50 WORDS:
- Who: A male narrator in his 40s and a (probably now) ex-friend who constantly boasts.
- Where: Not specified (personal/social context; no location given).
- When: Recent past / present (the narrator says this happened 'recently').

COMPLETE STORY:
Title: AITA for cutting a friend out of my life for their constant boasting?

Hi there, M 40s. I recently had to bring up a lot of concerns with a (probably now) ex friend of mine. Here are the details.

I've known this individual for several years, since we were literally four. I always got some kind of vibe from him that wasn't right, but we became good friends throughout several years. We'd drink together, stay up playing video games, and call each other once in awhile.

Some time in college years I started to recognize that his personality towards me started to change. He seemed to call me when he would drive home from work, solely to talk about all of his ideas and projects he's working on. I wasn't much of a phone person so it seemed a bit frustrating but he was a friend so I was fine with it.

As an aside, he always commented about finding women to "get laid" and while I was about it too, it wasn't something I'd always discuss with him. After awhile it got old. Additionally he cheated some of his ex girlfriends, did a lot of unethical computer stuff, and plagiarized a lot fo his way through high school and college.

Over the years I started to recognize that our relationship primarily turned into him calling me up to inform me about a new job he started and it's salary. I wasn't the most interested in that but I'd congratulate him for it.

Then I started to recognize a lot of weird things he'd do. He would lose his job and immediately go to Vegas and boast about his vacation on Facebook. I commented on his page about him losing his job and he deleted it, saying he didn't want others to know. Hed constantly post about "going on vacation" even while he was in the middle of law school, a university that he attended that was so new it wasn't even accredited. He racked up hundreds of thousands of dollars in debt yet would still boast about money, constantly show off his vacations, and hopped from job to job. He never kept a position for more than two years.

We'd often times meet up, but I noticed he would get sloppy drunk and constantly talk, make unfunny jokes, and try to be the center of attention. It was wearing on me, but I just had to write it off as that's what his personality was. Every time I'd see him he'd have something to brag about and I let it go.

More "one sided" conversations would happen and I started to recognize comments that he would laugh about that I felt were more insulting than anything else. One day I asked him what one of them meant (because it sounded insulting to me) and his response was "just a joke!" My patience was wearing thin. I told him to stop doing that.

Recently I went to an event and I hadn't heard from him in probably six months. I was in a crowd of people and he called. I texted back that I couldn't talk. He called again and I reiterated I couldn't chat that I was busy. I told him to text back.

"Big news! I'm making XXX money!"

I lost it with him. Not even a "how are you" or "what have you been doing lately?" An immediate launch into him and his money. I told him I wasn't interested in being someone to just gloat at and that I've said it multiple times. Additionally I reminded him that all of his previous positions he either quit because it wasn't enough money or he was fired from because he couldn't do the job, and his XXX job he probably wasn't likely to keep anyhow.

He apologized and I wished him a good night.

A few days later I recognized he blocked me on Facebook and LinkedIn. I texted him why and I never got a response. I guess that's it.

This guy just seemed to gradually transition into a used car salesman friend, show off the shiny things and hide the negative. Others that know him share the same kind of sentiments about him. I'm not interested in being used for someone seeking validation, so I'm done trying to accept him.

But part of me feels I was too harsh. We do have a long history together, but most of it is mired in his "me first" attitude.

AITA here?

Title: WIBTAH if I dont go to the Christmas party

Our franchise owner has five stores, so all five stores meet at a mid point location for the yearly Christmas party. I didnt attend last year and I wasnt planning on it this year either, but my coworkers are insisting. It's gonna be the same as last year, free dinner and drinks and carnival style games with prizes. The idea of it doesnt sound bad but the location is somewhat out of my way. It would mean driving in the dark, in winter, to an unfamiliar town. I get motion sickness as a passenger so getting a ride is off the table, which also means I can't drink to get through it lol.. so yeah, wibtah if I don't go?
